company.title: Our Company
company.subtitle: Over 25 years building the maritime future with excellence and innovation
company.aboutDescription: YPMARINAS is a leading company in maritime construction with over 25 years of experience. We specialize in the design, construction and maintenance of maritime infrastructures, combining technological innovation with environmental respect.
company.missionDescription: To develop maritime infrastructures of excellence that contribute to the sustainable development of coastal communities, using innovative technologies and respecting the environment.
company.visionDescription: To be the leading maritime construction company in the Mediterranean, recognized for the quality of our projects, the innovation of our solutions and our commitment to sustainability.
company.ceoDescription: Naval engineer with over 20 years of experience in international maritime projects.
company.ctoDescription: Specialist in coastal engineering and sustainable development with extensive European experience.

news.subtitle: Stay informed about our latest projects and industry developments

news.article1Title: Inauguration of the New Valencia Marina
news.article1Excerpt: YPMARINAS successfully completes the construction of a 350-berth marina in the port of Valencia, setting new sustainability standards.
news.article1Content: The new marina incorporates green technologies and smart management systems.
news.article1FullContent:
The new Valencia Marina represents a milestone in sustainable maritime construction. This 15,000 m² project incorporates the most advanced technologies in environmental management, including water treatment systems, integrated solar panels and recyclable construction materials.

The marina has 350 berths for vessels up to 50 meters in length, distributed across 4 main docks with complete services including electricity, drinking water, fuel and high-speed internet connection.

The project has been developed in close collaboration with port authorities and environmental organizations, guaranteeing minimal impact on the local marine ecosystem. Construction lasted 18 months and employed more than 45 specialized professionals.

The official inauguration will feature the presence of local authorities and representatives from the nautical sector, marking a new chapter in the modernization of Valencia port.
news.article2Excerpt: We begin the expansion of the Bilbao Port container terminal, increasing its operational capacity by 60%.
news.article2Content: The project includes the construction of new docks and modernization of existing infrastructures.
news.article2FullContent:
YPMARINAS has been selected to lead the most ambitious expansion of the Port of Bilbao in the last decade. This €35 million project will transform the container terminal, increasing its capacity from 2,500 to 4,000 TEU.

The works include the construction of 800 linear meters of new docks with depths up to 15 meters, allowing the docking of latest generation ships. Existing infrastructures will also be modernized with new automated crane systems and expanded storage areas.

The project will be executed in three phases to maintain port operability during construction. The first phase, which includes ground preparation and foundation construction, will begin next month.

This project will position the Port of Bilbao as one of the most efficient in northern Spain, significantly improving its competitiveness in the European market.
news.article3Title: Innovation in Sustainable Technologies for Maritime Construction
news.article3Excerpt: We present our latest innovations in eco-friendly materials and sustainable construction systems for maritime projects.
news.article3Content: New biocompatible materials and zero-emission construction processes.
news.article4Excerpt: International recognition for our energy self-sufficient floating marina project.
news.article4Content: The project integrates renewable energies and smart management systems.
news.article5Title: International Expansion: New Projects in France and Italy
news.article5Excerpt: We announce our European expansion with confirmed projects on the French Riviera and the port of Genoa.
news.article5Content: We consolidate our presence in the Mediterranean market.
news.article6Title: ISO 14001 Certification: Commitment to the Environment
news.article6Excerpt: YPMARINAS obtains ISO 14001 certification, reaffirming our commitment to environmental sustainability.
news.article6Content: The certification recognizes our environmental management processes.

contact.faqSubtitle: Find answers to the most common inquiries
contact.faq1Question: What types of maritime projects do you carry out?
contact.faq1Answer: We carry out all types of maritime projects: marinas, commercial ports, breakwaters, shipyards, floating constructions and coastal protection works.
contact.faq2Question: How long does it take to complete a project?
contact.faq2Answer: Times vary according to project complexity. Small projects can take 3-6 months, while large projects may require 12-24 months.
contact.faq3Question: Do you work with international certifications?
contact.faq3Answer: Yes, all our projects comply with international regulations and we have ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 certifications.
contact.faq4Answer: Yes, we offer complete preventive and corrective maintenance services for all installations we build, as well as for existing installations.
